text: The 1961 Italian Athletics Championships was the 51st edition of the Italian Athletics Championships and were held in Turin (track & field events). ==Champions== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:90%; text-align:left;" |- !Event !!Athlete !!Performance |- |100 metres|| Livio Berruti ||align=center|10.4 |- |200 metres|| Livio Berruti ||align=center|20.9 |- |400 metres|| Mario Fraschini ||align=center|47.0 |- |800 metres|| Francesco Bianchi ||align=center|1:50.7 |- |1500 metres|| Alfredo Rizzo ||align=center|3:51.8 |- |5000 metres|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|14:33.6 |- |10,000 metres|| Franco Antonelli ||align=center|30:41.6 |- |110 metres hurdles|| Nereo Svara ||align=center|14.3 |- |400 metres hurdles|| Salvatore Morale ||align=center|51.2 |- |3000 metres steeplechase|| Gianfranco Sommaggio ||align=center|9:14.4 |- |High jump|| Walter Zamparelli ||align=center|1.98 |- |Pole vault|| Mario Gaspari ||align=center|4.05 |- |Long jump|| Raffaele Piras ||align=center|7.37 |- |Triple jump|| Enzo Cavalli ||align=center|15.56 |- |Shot put|| Silvano Meconi ||align=center|16.95 |- |Discus throw|| Carmelo Rado ||align=center|52.72 |- |Hammer throw|| Manlio Cristin ||align=center|59.15 |- |Javelin throw|| Carlo Lievore ||align=center|75.48* |- |Decathlon|| Franco Sar ||align=center|5856 |- |Half Marathon|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|1:02:09# |- |Marathon|| Francesco Perrone ||align=center|02:27:22 |- |10,000 metres track walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|45:11.4 |- |20 km road walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|01:33:34 |- |50 km road walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|04:33:05 |- |Cross country (long course)|| Francesco Perrone ||align=center| |} ===Women=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font- size:90%;
